content:
Is it a good idea to just go and try implementing my must_bind pre-RFC, then submit a possibly under-designed prototype-ish pull request?

The discussion on the pre-RFC thread just stopped without any conclusion.

The feature is solely about improving diagnostics, so maybe a real RFC is not needed until stabilisation.

(in short: it's about #[must_bind] attribute that supplements #[must_use] and also warns on let _ = acquire_semaphore_guard();)
FWIW, since this is basically a new lint, I wouldn't expect it to need a full RFC, just an FCP or maybe an MCP if t-lang has MCPs

Asked at t-lang: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/213817-t-lang/topic/must_bind

Shall I somehow close this topic on Zulip?
(FCP: you do the implementation and people decide on the PR. MCP: you say "I want to do this" and the lang team either says yes or no, but there's no checkboxes and no community feedback period)
Well, yes? That's why it goes through t-lang

_Vi said:

Asked at t-lang: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/213817-t-lang/topic/must_bind

Shall I somehow close this topic on Zulip?

Unfortunately I don't believe there's a way to do that

Joshua Nelson said:

Well, yes? That's why it goes through t-lang

Yeah, just wanted to make sure that was clear :)
